business.headline: Regulatory body warns against rising NPS scams, issues these guidelines The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) has cautioned subscribers of the National Pension Scheme (NPS) and Atal Pension Yojayna (APY) regarding fraudulent calls demanding money to release pension funds.

Government may set up reserve fund for stable EPFO interest rates: ReportThe labour and employment ministry is conducting an internal study to explore the creation of an interest stabilisation reserve fund under the EPFO, sources said familiar with the matter.

PM SVANidhi scheme: Know about eligibility and Rs 30,000 credit cardsPM SVANidhi scheme eligibility: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in her Budget 2025 speech announced providing credit cards under the PM SVANidhi scheme.

Is your money safe in co-operative banks safe? RBI's latest curbs raise concernConcerns over New India Co-operative Bank's financial stability and a potential Rs 122 crore scam prompted the RBI to take strict action. This incident has added to the growing list of cooperative banks facing regulatory action.

India Inc sees worst quarter in 5 years: What it means for stock market? The recently concluded Q3 earnings season has been the weakest for India Inc since the first quarter of FY21, according to a report by domestic brokerage firm Motilal Oswal.

Radhika Gupta on market volatility: Bad times don't last. Good investors doRadhika Gupta's advice comes as stock markets continue to witness a downward trend, with the sell-off in smallcap and midcap stocks intensifying.

Senco Gold share price tumbles 32% in 2 sessions. Here's what brokerages saySenco Gold stock price: The sell-off started on February 14 after the company reported its quarterly numbers showing profits plunged 69.3% to Rs 33.48 crore compared to Rs 109.32 crore a year ago.

Markets down, volatility up: 3 factors making Dalal Street investors nervousThe NSE Nifty50 has stumbled, dropping 3.2% in just eight trading sessions and slipping below the psychologically important 23,000 mark. The Sensex tells a similar tale of woe, falling over 3% to fall below 76,000.

TCS to issue hike letters soon; salary raise likely between 4-8%: ReportThe annual salary hikes at leading IT firms have gradually reduced over the years. In FY24, TCS employees received an average hike of 7-9%, while in FY22, the hikes were around 10.5%.

Should you avoid smallcap, midcap stocks amid ongoing market correction?One of the primary reasons behind this downturn is the steep valuations of smallcap and midcap stocks, which analysts believe had reached unsustainable levels.

Sensex tanks over 600 points: 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayStock market today: At 9:58 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 577.20 points, trading at 75,362.01, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 176.30 points, standing at 22,752.95.
Sensex, Nifty fall as market sell-off continues; Mahindra shares fall 4% The S&P BSE Sensex lost 458.91 points to 75,480.30, while the NSE Nifty50 shed 145.70 points to 22,783.55 as of 9:42 AM.

entertainment.headline: Stray Kids' Felix suffers fracture after car accident, misses group's fan meetFelix, a member of the boy band Stray Kids, suffered an arm fracture in a minor car accident, causing him to miss the band's fifth fan meeting.

South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron wanted to make a comeback to films, open a cafeSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, who was found dead in her apartment on Sunday, had wished to make a comeback to the entertainment world, revealed a friend recently.

Gajraj Rao, Renuka Shahane's Dupahiya to bring laughter and chaos to Prime VideoPrime Video's Dupahiya is set in a crime-free village where the first-ever theft of a motorbike creates chaos and drama. Starring Gajraj Rao and Renuka Shahane, the comedy series starts streaming on March 7.

South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, 24, found deadSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, known for her roles in Bloodhounds and The Man from Nowhere, was found dead at her home in Seoul. She was 24. Authorities are investigating the circumstances of her death, with no signs of foul play reported yet.

The White Lotus S3 review: Predictable? Yes. Addictive? Also, yesReleased-Mon Feb 17, 2025The White Lotus Season 3 review: The White Lotus returns with a new season set in Thailand, offering a fresh cultural backdrop while retaining its biting satire on the ultra-rich. The series continues to entertain with its dark humour and ensemble cast, though its formula is starting to feel familiar. Read our full review.

Kanye West says he fought 5 hours for Grammy tickets amid guest list confusionRapper Kanye West, in a post on X, revealed that he fought for five hours to secure Grammy tickets amid guest list chaos. This comes amid claims that Kanye arrived at the event uninvited.

Comedian Anubhav Bassi's Lucknow show cancelled after warning over foul languageThe shows of comedian Anubhav Singh Bassi in Lucknow were cancelled due to concerns over inappropriate content, following a complaint by the UP Women's Commission vice-chairperson. Authorities cited potential law and order issues as reasons for the cancellation.

Watch: Chum Darang blushes as Karan Veer confesses love on Valentine's DayKaran Veer Mehra confessed his love for Chum Darang on Valentine's Day. Chum shared a post from their romantic outing on social media.
Watch: Ed Sheeran pauses Delhi concert as fan faints, wears Team India jerseyEd Sheeran wrapped up his India tour in Gurugram on February 15. He paused his concert briefly to help a fan who fainted.

Shalin Bhanot reacts to India's Got Latent Row, advocates self-disciplineTV actor Shalin Bhanot has reacted to the controversy surrounding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's comment on India's Got Latent during the FDCI's India Men's Weekend in Jaipur. He emphasised self-discipline and responsibility.

Today is a victory: Jay-Z reacts after rape lawsuit against him droppedIn a significant legal victory, rapper Jay-Z has seen a sexual assault lawsuit against him dismissed. The rapper and entrepreneur expressed relief and satisfaction over the court's decision.

No one can save him: Mahabharat actor threatens Ranveer Allahbadia Actor Saurav Gurjar openly threatened Ranveer Allahbadia over his recent remarks on India's Got Latent. In a video message, the actor requested the government to take strict action against the podcaster.

Drake releases new album amid feud with Kendrick Lamar, fails to impress fansDrake appears to have ended his feud with Kendrick Lamar in his latest album, but fans remain unimpressed. Released on Valentine's Day, the album in collaboration with PartyNextDoor marks his first new work since the Super Bowl halftime show.

Bharti Singh supports Samay Raina amid India's Got Latent controversyComedian Bharti Singh supported Samay Raina amid the India's Got Latent controversy. The comedian praised Samay and said that he is very sweet, and anyone can become his fan once they get to meet him.

Women's panel summons Elvish Yadav over remarks against Chum Darang on Feb 17YouTuber Elvish Yadav has been summoned by a women's panel following his racist remarks against Chum Darang. Yadav criticised her name and nationality, sparking courage among northeastern citizens.

Apoorva Mukhija aka Rebel Kid removed from official IIFA ambassador listApoorva Mukhija, known as Rebel Kid, has been removed from the IIFA ambassador list following controversy over her appearance in Samay Raina's show, India's Got Latent. The decision follows threats from Karni Sena to disrupt her upcoming shoot.

Fighting zombies to playing a psychopath: The many faces of Choi Woo-shikLong before Choi Woo-shik became a household name thanks to Parasite, he had already amassed an impressive filmography. On this week's K-Fix, we'll have a closer look at his notable works, crafted long before his Oscar-winning turn in Parasite.

The Potato Lab trailer: Kang Tae-oh is set to headline upcoming rom-comThe trailer for The Potato Lab, a romantic comedy-drama starring Kang Tae-oh and Lee Sun-bin, has been released. The series, set in a rural potato research institute, promises a blend of romance, comedy, and workplace drama.

Dhoom Dhaam review: Romance meets thrill in this Yami Gautam-Pratik Gandhi filmReleased-Fri Feb 14, 2025Dhoom Dhaam movie review: Dhoom Dhaam blends romance with action and comedy, offering a refreshing alternative to traditional Valentine's Day films. Starring Yami Gautam and Pratik Gandhi, the movie delivers a thrilling and entertaining experience perfect for a cosy night in.

Scared of Loving You: Selena Gomez's new song for her Valentine Benny Blanco out Lovebirds Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco have now collaborated for a new album titled I Said I Love You First. On the occasion of Valentine's Day 2025, Selena released the first single from the album, Scared of Loving You.

Ilaiyaraaja appears in Court in dispute with music company over his compositionsIn 2010, Music Master filed a lawsuit seeking a ban on the use of these songs on YouTube and social media platforms, calling it "unauthorised".

Are K-Drama men written by women too good to be true? | Valentine Special K-drama male leads have captivated audiences with their idealised traits, offering a romantic fantasy of the perfect partner. These characters, crafted by female screenwriters, challenge traditional portrayals. This Valentine's Day we analyse if they are too good to be true.
Prime Video's Rings of Power renewed for third seasonPrime Video's Rings of Power has been renewed for the third installment, the makers announced recently. Its second season was released last year.

Mrs director Arati Kadav on backlash over missing credits: Glad it was called outDirector Arati Kadav addresses the backlash over Mrs not crediting The Great Indian Kitchen in the trailer, stressing the need for proper recognition. Mrs, starring Sanya Malhotra, is streaming on Zee5.

Viral video: Kanan Gill made same remark as Ranveer Allahbadia years agoAs Ranveer Allahbadia faces backlash for his India's Got Latent remark, an old video of Kanan Gill asking the same question resurfaces on the internet.

Kanye West, Bianca Censori heading for divorce? Team clarifiesIt was previously reported that singer-rapper Kanye West and his wife, Bianca Censori, had split and were headed for divorce. However, a recent development has refuted these claims, labelling them as "tabloid rumours."

Sanya Malhotra's Mrs. makes questions on marital rape, mechanical sex personalImagine a woman bleeding for five days in a month, and those five days being the most peaceful in her life because she can finally refuse sex to her husband. He can't assert his power over her. That's how Sanya Malhotra's 'Mrs.' unsettles you and makes you think.

Singer-composer Vishal Dadlani meets with an accident, undergoes treatmentVishal Dadlani of the Vishal-Sheykhar duo is undergoing treatment after an accident, leading to the postponement of their upcoming concert scheduled for March 2.

Not just Gujarat, all Samay Raina shows cancelled amid India's Got Latent rowSamay Raina's shows in India have been cancelled following controversy around India's Got Latent, with Gujarat shows being the first to be affected.

Singer Jonita Gandhi to perform at Lollapalooza India, will open for Shawn MendesJonita Gandhi will perform at Lollapalooza India on March 8, opening for Shawn Mendes. Her latest single Channa has also been nominated for a Juno Award.

Twilight star Taylor Lautner to return as werewolf in self-aware werewolf seriesTwilight star Taylor Lautner is returning to portray a werewolf in the self-aware Amazon series. Details of the show are yet to be revealed.

Anupamaa actor Rupali Ganguly seeks blessings at Maha KumbhActor Rupali Ganguly visited Maha Kumbh in Prayagraj with her family. She shared moments from her spiritual visit, including performing aarti, attending a hawan, and meeting a saint.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui begins Raat Akeli Hai 2 shooting in LucknowActor Nawazuddin Siddiqui has begun Raat Akeli Hai 2 shooting in Lucknow. The actor will be seen sharing screen space with Chitragandha Singh.

Olivia Swann on NCIS: Sydney, her character's growth & challenges In this exclusive interview with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal, Olivia Swann dives deep into her role in NCIS: Sydney, sharing insights into her character's journey, development, and challenges throughout the series.

Rozlyn Khan sues Ankita Lokhande for defamation over 'cheap' remark TV actor Rozlyn Khan took legal action against Ankita Lokhande's recent comments. Ankita had called her 'cheap', for her claims about Hina Khan's cancer battle.

Jackson Wang makes a powerful comeback with High Alone from Magic Man 2Jackson Wang drops a new single, High Alone, that marks the beginning of his new album, MAGIC MAN 2. The album promises a deep dive into themes of identity and personal transformation, set against a backdrop of atmospheric production and introspective lyrics.

Actor John Lithgow approached to play Albus Dumbledore in Harry Potter seriesAward-winning American actor John Lithgow has reportedly been approached to play the iconic character of Hogwarts principal Albus Dumbledore in HBO's Harry Potter series.

Rupali Ganguly's stepdaughter calls her 'evil step lady', issues clarificationRupali Ganguly's stepdaughter, Esha Verma, clarified her viral social media post against the actor. Esha requested privacy.

Truth behind viral video of Ranveer Allahbadia crying over 'loss of work'Amid backlash over India's Got Latent, an old video of Ranveer Allahbadia crying resurfaces. In the video, the podcaster is seen breaking down over 'loss of work'.

Jonas Brothers hint at big change for 2025, shocked fans ask, 'another breakup?'The Jonas Brothers shared a letter on social media that briefly sent fans into a panic. In it, they hinted at their 2025 lineup and expressed gratitude to their fans for supporting them throughout their musical journey.

general news.headline: New crowd control plan after Delhi stampede: Focus on 60 stations, use of AIDays after a stampede killed 18 people at the New Delhi railway station, the Centre has introduced a new crowd control plan, including the creation of permanent holding zones at 60 high-traffic stations, sources told India Today TV.

Turban thrown in dustbin, tortured in US detention camp: Deportee recounts horrorA 23-year-old man who was deported from the US to Amritsar along with 111 others on Sunday alleged he faced torture in a detention camp when he was caught entering the US illegally. He claimed he was in shackles on the deportation flight.

Gaffe machine Sam Pitroda says China issue 'blown out of proportion', blames USDuring Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Washington last week, US President Donald Trump offered to mediate in the India-China border dispute. The offer was, however, rejected, with Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri saying New Delhi would approach a bilateral approach.

Delhi quake: Government warns of possible aftershocks, PM's 'stay calm' appealPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday urged the residents of Delhi-NCR region to stay calm and follow safety protocols in case of possible aftershocks following a 4.0 magnitude earthquake in the national capital.

Why Elon Musk takes 4-year-old son to every meeting.  Xtension or X-factor?Be it a meeting with PM Modi or a visit to the Oval Office, Elon Musk's son X seems to be part of his retinue. Why does Musk take the 4-year-old to meetings? This might have to do with Musk's lonely childhood, his strategy to carve a more acceptable image or the projection of an extension.

There is a limit to petitions: Top court defers pleas on Places of Worship Act Earlier, the Supreme Court expressed its displeasure over the filing of several fresh pleas in a case related to the validity of the Places of Worship Act, which mandates the religious character of a place to be maintained as it existed on August 15, 1947.

Indian flag missing from Karachi stadium before Champions Trophy, video goes viralIn a video that has gone viral on social media, the Indian flag was reportedly missing at the National stadium in Karachi ahead of the Champions Trophy 2025. At ICC events, it is common practice to have flags of all the participating nations displayed at each venue.

US site drops Taiwan independence reference, China urges it to 'correct mistakes'China urged the US to "correct its mistakes" after the State Department removed wording opposing Taiwan independence. Beijing called it a provocative move, while Taiwan welcomed US support.

Akshaye Khanna's Aurangzeb act in Chhaava: Internet says actor is back and howChhaava: The internet cannot get enough of Akshaye Khanna's performance as Mughal emperor Aurangzeb. Apart from Akshaye, the film also stars Vicky Kaushal and Rashmika Mandanna in pivotal roles.

What EVM data Supreme Court doesn't want Election Commission to eraseThe court directed the poll panel not to erase or reload EVM data for scrutiny, questioning its SOPs and Rs 40,000 fee. The panel must clarify before the March hearing

No money, Pandya brothers said they had Maggi for 3 years: Nita Ambani on MI findIPL 2025: Mumbai Indians owner Nita Ambani revealed how the franchise were able to land the Pandya brothers and Jasprit Bumrah and make them a vital part of the Indian cricket team. Bumrah and the Pandya brothers won multiple titles with MI.

After Revanth Reddy's caste jibe at Modi, BJP questions Rahul Gandhi's lineageBJP and Congress are locked in a caste-politics battle in Telangana after Chief Minister Revanth Reddy claimed Prime Minister Modi was a 'legally converted Backward Class.' BJP leader Bandi Sanjay hit back, questioning Rahul Gandhi's caste, alleging Rajiv Gandhi was a Parsi.

Milind Deora's special message for Maharashtra student who went paragliding to collegeIn a post on X, Shiv Sena MP Milind Deora shared a heartfelt message for the Maharashtra student whose paragliding video, showing him flying to the college to avoid traffic, went viral last week.

Trinamool's 'half minister, side gig' jibe at Ashwini Vaishnaw on Delhi stampedeDelhi Stampede: Union Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has come under fire after the stampede at New Delhi Railway station claimed 18 lives on Friday. The TMC repeated the 'half minister' jibe to slam the minister for holding two key ministries.

Appear in person tomorrow, not via video, cyber cell tells comic Samay RainaIndia's Got Latent Controversy: The Maharashtra Cyber Cell has directed YouTuber Samay Raina to appear in person on February 18 to record his statement regarding the obscene remarks row on the now-deleted show India's Got Latent.

Video: Meet Trump's special guest at Daytona 500, his granddaughter CarolinaCarolina, adorable in a white frock and a 'Make America Great Again' cap, was photographed with her "grandpa", US President Donald Trump, at the event.

Prateik's wife on Raj Babbar's absence from wedding: All who mattered were thereActor Prateik Babbar married Priya Banerjee in an intimate ceremony but didn't invite father Raj Babbar. Priya said everyone who mattered to them and who they consider as family were a part of the celebration.

4.0 magnitude earthquake jolts Delhi-NCR out of sleep, big tremors, rumbling noiseA 4.0 magnitude earthquake hit Delhi-NCR early on Monday with its epicentre in the national capital. The tremors lasted for a few seconds and caused panic among residents.

Sensex tanks over 600 points: 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayStock market today: At 9:58 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 577.20 points, trading at 75,362.01, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 176.30 points, standing at 22,752.95.

The state of the mob and the failure of the stateAt the New Delhi railway station on Saturday night, a "sea of humanity" travelling for a Kumbh dip was waiting for the train to Prayagraj. A platform-change announcement triggered a tsunami in that sea. Faith, fate, and a whole lot of frantic feet. India has a mob problem.

India Art Fair: Is social media turning art into a mainstream sensation? India Art Fair's latest edition was sold out. Was it just social media outreach playing its part, or were genuine art connoisseurs, in larger numbers, filling the void?

BYD Sealion 7 launched in India, price starts at Rs 48.9 lakhBYD Sealion 7 electric SUV Price: The Sealion 7 comes with an 82.56 kWh battery pack and is available in two variants: Performance and Premium.

Delhi Chief Minister's oath on February 20 at 4.30 pm after BJP meet: SourcesOut of 48 BJP legislators who won in the recently-concluded Delhi Assembly elections, 15 names have been shortlisted -- nine will be selected for key posts of the Chief Minister, state cabinet ministers and the Speaker -- according to sources.

Why Delhi's 4.0 earthquake felt stronger than it wasStrong tremors jolted Delhi-NCR residents out of sleep on Monday morning due to a 4.0 magnitude earthquake that shook buildings and left people terrified. But, was the earthquake as strong as it felt?

Pics: Vijay Deverakonda's holy trip to Maha Kumbh 2025, Kashi Vishwanath templeVijay Deverakonda, along with his mother, visited the Maha Kumbh 2025. The actor shared a post with glimpses from the holy trip,

Kate Winslet to make directorial debut with family drama Goodbye JuneAcademy Award-winning actor Kate Winslet will soon be making her directorial debut with the family drama, Goodbye June. It will be produced by Netflix.

How Sivakarthikeyan crafted his success one film at a time Tamil actor Sivakarthikeyan is celebrating his 39th birthday today. On his birthday, let's take a look at his career and how his successes and failures shaped him as one of the leading stars.

Ibrahim Ali Khan-Khushi Kapoor deal with 'Galatfehmiyan' in Nadaaniyan's new songActors Ibrahim Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor try to navigate heartbreak in the latest song from 'Nadaaniyan' titled 'Galatfehmiyan'.

sports.headline: Bad dream to new dawn: Pakistan ready to welcome major ICC event after 3 decadesChampions Trophy 2025: Pakistan is set to host a major cricket tournament after nearly three decades, marking a significant comeback for international cricket in the country. Despite India opting to play in Dubai, excitement is high, with Pakistan hoping to host a successful tournament.

After missing WPL, star RCB all-rounder skips Sri Lanka series Sophie Devine has pulled out of New Zealand's limited-overs series against Sri Lanka. Devine, earlier, opted out of the Women's Premier League (WPL) where she represents Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB).

Indian flag missing from Karachi stadium before Champions Trophy, video goes viralIn a video that has gone viral on social media, the Indian flag was reportedly missing at the National stadium in Karachi ahead of the Champions Trophy 2025. At ICC events, it is common practice to have flags of all the participating nations displayed at each venue.

Jasprit Bumrah's absence gives Bangladesh a chance vs India: Imrul KayesChampions Trophy: Imrul Kayes said that Jasprit Bumrah's absence will give Bangladesh a decent chance in their match against India on February 20 at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Mohammed Shami can carry India's attack in Bumrah's absence: Laxmipathy BalajiChampions Trophy 2025: Former pacer Laxmipathy Balaji feels that Mohammed Shami could be the leader of the Indian bowling attack during Jasprit Bumrah's absence at the Champions Trophy. Shami made his return to international cricket during the England T20I series.

No money, Pandya brothers said they had Maggi for 3 years: Nita Ambani on MI findIPL 2025: Mumbai Indians owner Nita Ambani revealed how the franchise were able to land the Pandya brothers and Jasprit Bumrah and make them a vital part of the Indian cricket team. Bumrah and the Pandya brothers won multiple titles with MI.

Virat Kohli eyes Universe Boss Chris Gayle's historic record Champions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli has the chance of becoming the leading run-scorer in the tournament, going past the legendary Chris Gayle, who scored 791 runs from 17 matches.

My PR is my cricket: Ajinkya Rahane targets return to Indian Test teamRanji Trophy 2024-25: Ajinkya Rahane is aiming for a comeback into the Indian Test team as he feels there is cricket left in him. Rahane last played for India in Tests during the West Indies tour in 2023.

Not dissimilar to Jasprit Bumrah: Ex-captain defends Aussie spinner's bowling actionFormer Australia captain Tim Paine jumped to the defence of Matt Kuhnemann, claiming that the spinner has a similar action to that of Jasprit Bumrah. Kuhnemann was reported for suspect action after the Sri Lanka Test series.

When Shakib Al Hasan, Mahmudullah's heroics shocked New ZealandChampions Trophy: Back in 2017, Bangladesh recorded a famous win against New Zealand after Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah's heroic 224-run partnership at the Sophia Gardens in Cardiff. Shakib and Mahmudullah's twin centuries helped the Tigers chase down 266 with 16 balls to spare.

India to win Champions Trophy, Rohit Sharma highest run-getter: Michael ClarkeChampions Trophy 2025: Former Australia captain Michael Clarke feels that Rohit Sharma will be the highest run-getter in this year's Champions Trophy. Clarke also feels India will win the tournament once again with Rohit leading from the front.

Kuhnemann was reported for suspect action after the Sri Lanka Test series.

Shakib and Mahmudullah's twin centuries helped the Tigers chase down 266 with 16 balls to spare.

India to win Champions Trophy, Rohit Sharma highest run-getter: Michael ClarkeChampions Trophy 2025: Former Australia captain Michael Clarke feels that Rohit Sharma will be the highest run-getter in this year's Champions Trophy. Clarke also feels India will win the tournament once again with Rohit leading from the front.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
